title: Where To Practice Yoga In South America
text:
(c)Jean Henrique Wichinoski 
Yoga is a great complement to international travel, and offers a great outlet to allow you to release the stresses and strains that come with sitting in an airplane for several hours and passing through all of the customs and immigration checks. 
The exercise may not be the most dynamic or dramatic, but it has a great impact on the body that develops and maintains good strength, flexibility and promotes good breathing practices. It is an exercise and art form that has been used for thousands of years, it has now been exported around the world, and there are some great places in South America where you can enjoy yoga in spectacular surroundings. The Island Experience, Ilha Grande, Brazil 
This stunning island location offers everything you would need for a relaxing yoga retreat, and it seems that everything in the resort is designed to promote wellness and healthy living. The yoga studio has huge glass walls with ocean views to one side and views back over the rainforest in the other direction. Along with the yoga you can also enjoy wonderful healthy meals at the restaurant, a jacuzzi and sauna as well as being able to go kayaking and hiking in the surrounding area. Atmananda Yoga Retreat, Cartagena, Colombia 
The historic city of Cartagena is one of the most attractive in South America, and this yoga retreat offers you plenty of time to see the city as well as achieving a balance in your mind, body and spirit. The retreat is a branch of one of the leading New York yoga schools, and is set in a traditional colonial mansion in the city. The mansion also has a pool and rooftop terrace, while the spacious rooms offer wonderful surroundings to allow you make the most of your yoga retreat experience. Cancion del Corazon, Ecuador 
This destination is one that tries to provide a holistic experience that goes beyond just providing a wonderful location for a yoga retreat, but rather looks to develop a whole philosophy that brings visitors into a greater connection with their surroundings. 
Located in the countryside surrounding the town of Vilcabamba in the Andes, the yoga terrace is a wonderful place to practice, while the destination also grows a lot of its own food, has energy from solar panels and is a very healthy environment for you meditation and relaxation. Samana Chakra, Mancora, Peru 
This is a genuinely beautiful location overlooking the Pacific Ocean, and the facilities here really do help you to find a balance and to clear your mind so that you can focus on your yoga during your stay. 
The quiet and serene location for the yoga classes is ideal, and is served by experienced yoga instructors with years of experience. Comfortable rooms, a lovely swimming pool and access to the beach help to make this a wonderful yoga retreat destination. Canal Om, Valparaiso, Chile 
This destination is home to a wonderful yoga hall that is designed to match the surroundings found in a Japanese pagoda, and this helps to provide a calm and peaceful area to practice yoga. 
The resort is set in a wonderful area on the cliffs overlooking the ocean, while there are also swimming pools and beautiful locations where you can relax and simply enjoy the exquisite surroundings. The accommodation is spread over five separate houses, and is simple but comfortable, while there is also a small spa, and easy access to activities such as surfing and scuba diving. Enchanted Mountain Brazil, Santa Catarina 
This magical part of Brazil provides a wonderful backdrop to a yoga retreat, with lovely hillsides and stunning beaches that are delightful to explore. This destination has been hosting yoga retreats for over a decade, and it has a wonderful series of rooms and terraces to allow you to practice freely, or join the classes that are on offer. Combine this with the opportunity to take surfing lessons, and it becomes a wonderful, relaxing and entertaining retreat. South America Travel Essentials
